title: Full Retirement Age
description: The age at which a person may first become entitled to full or unreduced retirement benefits. For people born in 1960 or later, the full retirement age is 67.

title: Early Retirement
description: You can start receiving your Social Security retirement benefits as early as age 62, but the benefit amount will be lower than your full retirement benefit amount.

title: Delayed Retirement Credits
description: If you delay taking retirement benefits beyond your full retirement age, your benefit will increase by a certain percentage until age 70.

title: Earnings Test
description: If you're younger than full retirement age and make more than the yearly earnings limit, your earnings may reduce your benefit amount.

title: Spousal Benefits
description: Your spouse can receive up to 50% of your full retirement benefit amount if they wait until their full retirement age to receive benefits.
